name: places/ChIJzxhsvJlZwokRHr24KeUIbvg
formattedAddress: 295 Madison Ave Suite 707, New York, NY 10017, USA
adrFormatAddress: 295 Madison Ave Suite 707, New York, NY 10017, USA

originalText.text: Jennifer is not your average NYC therapist. She’s exceptional! Jennifer is both kind and compassionate. She helps people feel understood and accepted in her presence. She has advanced training that really sets her apart. Jennifer is both inclusive and and knowledgeable regarding LGBTQ identities and experiences. Besides her intelligence and thorough knowledge of therapy, she is personable, patient, and genuine. She will also challenge you when needed. The accelerated programs offered are completely worth it because they are much more focused and in-depth (no wasted time or money). Be ready to consider new perspectives and to be on your way to feeling healthier and more connected.

text.text: Jennifer is not your average NYC therapist. She’s exceptional! Jennifer is both kind and compassionate. She helps people feel understood and accepted in her presence. She has advanced training that really sets her apart. Jennifer is both inclusive and and knowledgeable regarding LGBTQ identities and experiences. Besides her intelligence and thorough knowledge of therapy, she is personable, patient, and genuine. She will also challenge you when needed. The accelerated programs offered are completely worth it because they are much more focused and in-depth (no wasted time or money). Be ready to consider new perspectives and to be on your way to feeling healthier and more connected.

originalText.text:
As a clinician in psychiatry, I have nothing but the highest regards for Jennifer and her practice she has built that continues to thrive!
She is the first therapist I’ve encountered that provides resources even before patients meet her on her website. Jennifer stays current on new changes and developments in the field of psychotherapy and treats both individuals that suffer from a wide variety of psychiatric conditions as well as helping struggling couples or partners that want to keep their bonds intact.

Jennifer is excellent at finding the deep rooted issues as she is a person who actually listens. She is a non-judgemental, warm, caring, and beyond effective therapist. She’s my go to therapist referral here in NYC. She helps people feel better and more connected - to themselves and others. Her practical Relationship Guide is a wonderful resource, I distribute it frequently to my patients. She’s experienced with treating trauma, family-of-origin issues, relationships distress, as well as anxiety and depression. Whether pursuing therapy as an individual or with a partner, Jennifer provides a safe place to make meaningful progress. I highly recommend her!
